items.title: Last day to buy PFC shares to qualify for dividend as stock approaches ex-date
items.description: Investors have a final chance today, November 25, to buy shares of Power Finance Corporation and Shyamkamal Investments to qualify for their interim dividends. PFC offers Rs 3.65 per share, while Shyamkamal Investments declared Rs 0.10 per share. Both stocks turn ex-dividend tomorrow, November 26, meaning only shareholders on record by then will receive the payouts.

items.title: HDFC AMC 1:1 bonus issue: Stock nears record date. Do you own?
items.description: Investors have a final chance today to buy HDFC AMC shares for a bonus issue. The company is offering one new share for every existing share held. This corporate action aims to increase liquidity and lower the per-share price. The stock has shown strong performance over the past year. However, recent periods indicate a cooling phase.

items.title: Stock to buy in 2025 for long term: Senco Gold, M&M among 5 stocks that could give 16-56% return
items.description: Brokerages remain broadly optimistic across key sectors, issuing strong Buy calls on a diverse set of companies ranging from jewellery and autos to infrastructure, chemicals, and defence-related manufacturing. We have collated a list of recommendations from top brokerage firms from ETNow and other sources:

items.title: Positive Breakout: These 9 stocks cross above their 200 DMAs
items.description: In the Nifty500 pack, 9 stocks' closing prices crossed above their 200 DMA (Daily Moving Averages) on November 24, 2025, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. The 200-day daily moving average (DMA) is used by traders as a key indicator for determining the overall trend in a particular stock. As long as the stock is priced above the 200-day SMA on the daily timeframe, it is generally considered to be in an overall uptrend. Take a look:

items.title: Wall Street rallies on tech rebound, rising rate cut bets
items.description: Indian stock markets saw a strong start to the week. Investors are optimistic about a potential US Federal Reserve interest rate cut in December. This has boosted confidence despite concerns about high tech stock prices. Economic data releases are expected this week, offering further insights into the market's direction. The holiday shopping season also begins, with expectations of record sales.

items.title: GIFT Nifty up 20 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
items.description: Indian equities experienced selling pressure on Monday, with the Nifty falling below 26,000 due to profit booking. Analysts anticipate cautious market sentiment until progress is seen in India-US trade talks and GDP numbers are released. Fluctuating foreign flows are expected to add to interim volatility.

items.title: Stocks in news: Dr Reddy's, GAIL, Hudco, HUL, Acme Solar
items.description: Indian markets experienced a subdued trading session, closing nearly half a percent lower due to global uncertainties and continued FII selling. With the monthly expiry approaching, volatility is expected to remain high. Investors are advised to maintain a stock-specific approach and accumulate quality stocks on dips.

items.title: Asian stocks track US gains on Fed rate cut bets
items.description: Asian stocks mirrored Wall Street's gains, driven by growing confidence in a potential Federal Reserve interest-rate cut in December and a rebound in technology shares. This optimism follows Fed Governor Christopher Waller's signal of support for a rate reduction, suggesting November's pullback may set the stage for a December rally.

items.title: FPIs extend IT sell-off, dump Rs 4,873 crore in first half of November
items.description: Foreign investors are selling Indian IT shares heavily. This trend continues as valuations remain high and AI opportunities are missed. Other sectors like consumer services and healthcare also saw selling. Delays in the US-India trade deal are a factor. Telecommunication sector received inflows due to a large deal. Oil & gas and 'Others' saw purchases. Investors remain cautious on India.

items.title: IT counters' weak show could be a silver lining: Motilal Oswal Financial
items.description: Investors may consider increasing their stake in Indian IT companies. Valuations are now attractive after a period of underperformance. Spending on Generative AI services is expected to pick up in the coming quarters. The Nifty IT index has lagged the benchmark Nifty. This presents an opportunity for selective and gradual portfolio adjustments.

items.title: WeWork India posts strong Q2 growth, eyes faster FY26 expansion
items.description: WeWork India reported robust double-digit growth in revenue and EBITDA for the September 2025 quarter, with sustained momentum expected to drive faster top-line growth in FY26. The company is focused on capacity expansion and strengthening its balance sheet, aiming for near-zero debt by March 2026. Analysts maintain a 'buy' rating, citing strong performance and future potential.

items.title: Fast food, fast growth: Investors queue for quick-service restaurants
items.description: India’s quick service restaurant (QSR) sector is sizzling again. Multiple deals are in motion as fast-expanding chains attract serious investor appetite, sources told us.

items.title: 1729 Capital gets RBI nod to raise Suryoday stake
items.description: The Reserve Bank of India has approved foreign portfolio investor 1729 Capital to increase its stake in Suryoday Small Finance Bank to 7.14%. Previously holding 3.81%, the FPI will now require prior RBI consent for any further stake increases or if their holding drops below 5%.

items.title: How will revised BSDA rules impact demat account holders?
items.description: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has proposed excluding delisted securities and zero-coupon, zero-principal bonds from portfolio value calculations for basic services demat accounts. This move aims to ensure fairness and prevent artificial inflation of holdings, as these securities lack realisable market value or investment potential.

items.title: HAL skids after Tejas crash; analysts expect limited hit
items.description: Hindustan Aeronautics shares extended losses Monday following a Tejas aircraft accident during a Dubai air show. Analysts anticipate limited financial impact on the company's orderbook and execution, noting fighter jet crashes are not uncommon. While near-term pressure and slowed export negotiations are possible, the incident occurred at an air show, not during a mission.

items.title: Yuan powers towards its biggest annual gains since 2020
items.description: The yuan is set for its sharpest annual gain since 2020, despite pressures such as slow growth, weak investment and low interest rates. Its steady appreciation has revived speculation that China is renewing efforts to boost the currency’s global role. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Jefferies initiates buy on LG Electronics shares with Rs 1,980 target price
items.description: Jefferies has initiated coverage on LG Electronics India with a Buy rating and a target price of Rs 1,980, implying a 21% upside. The brokerage sees strong rerating potential as the stock trades 10–15% below peers like Blue Star and Havells. Its bullish view is supported by LGEL’s market leadership, superior margins, and capacity expansion plans to capitalise on rising demand.

items.title: Groww shares jump over 3% but still down 22% from record high. What should investors do?
items.description: Billionbrains Garage Ventures, parent of Groww, saw its shares climb after a recent slide. Despite volatility, analysts remain optimistic about Groww's long-term prospects due to its dominant digital platform and low customer acquisition costs, reflected in strong financial metrics. However, concerns over elevated valuations and potential SEBI regulatory tightening in the F&O segment linger.

items.title: India looking beyond Horlicks and Lux? A story of struggling HUL even as Sensex doubled in 5 years
items.description: Hindustan Unilever faces challenges as its growth slows. Traditional brands like Horlicks and Lux are seeing reduced demand. New-age competitors are gaining ground in beauty and personal care. Home care remains a strong segment. HUL is implementing strategies for volume recovery and sharper segmentation. Investors anticipate steady growth rather than rapid returns.

items.title: Dr. Reddy’s Laboratories shares jump over 1% as European Commission approves biosimilar AVT03
items.description: Dr. Reddy's Laboratories secured European Commission approval for AVT03, a biosimilar to Prolia and Xgeva, for osteoporosis and bone complications. This significant milestone, following a positive CHMP recommendation, allows marketing across EU member states and EEA countries.  Dr. Reddy's, in partnership with Alvotech, will commercialize the drug under brands Acyvbra and Xbonzy.

items.title: Sensex off to a flat start, Nifty below 26,000 as IT, oil & gas stocks fall
items.description: Indian stock markets opened on a subdued note today. The Sensex and Nifty saw slight dips. Losses in IT and oil & gas sectors weighed on the indices. However, gains in metal and PSU bank stocks provided some support. Broader markets also experienced minor declines.

items.title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Jefferies maintain buy on Lupin; Motilal Oswal initiates coverage on Blue Star
items.description: Brokerages shared a mixed outlook across sectors: Jefferies stays bullish on Lupin on the back of steady US growth and strong margins, while Motilal Oswal begins coverage on Blue Star with a neutral view, citing near-term demand softness despite solid long-term fundamentals.

items.title: Ceigall India shares rise 3% after winning Rs 58.5 crore annual contract for 35 years
items.description: Ceigall India shares: The company received an LoI from REC Power Development & Consultancy for a 35-year infrastructure project worth ₹585 million annually. The project involves setting up a 400/220 kV Velgaon GIS substation under TBCB norms. The company must submit a ₹9.35 crore performance guarantee within 10 days.

items.title: India's ‘AI losers’ just made investors richer by Rs 2.6 lakh crore & nobody saw the boom coming
items.description: Indian IT stocks, once dismissed as "AI losers," have surged 10% since October, adding Rs 2.6 lakh crore in market capitalization. Investors are betting on a long-awaited AI services inflection point, with companies like TCS and Coforge showing significant gains. This comeback follows years of muted growth, as the sector now aligns with strengths in AI applications and services.

items.title: High frequency firms see India profits surge despite regulatory curbs
items.description: High-frequency trading firms have posted robust profit growth in India despite regulatory curbs, highlighting their ability to navigate the $5.4 trillion equity market. Hudson River Trading led with a 156% profit surge for the fiscal year ending March 31. Other firms, including Optiver, AlphaGrep Securities, and Graviton Research Capital, also reported strong annual gains, reflecting resilience and strategic agility.

items.title: Siemens Energy India shares rally 4% post robust Q4, strong order book
items.description: Siemens Energy India shares could see activity today as it posted robust financial results for the fourth quarter of FY2025. Revenue and profit saw significant increases, supported by a substantial rise in the order backlog. The company declared a dividend, reflecting its strong operational performance. Continued demand for energy and electrification solutions is expected to drive future growth.

items.title: Paras Defence shares jump 2% after MoU with IUAC for MRI magnet system
items.description: Paras Defence and Space Technologies shares are likely to draw investor attention on Tuesday, November 25, following the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Inter-University Accelerator Centre (IUAC), New Delhi. IUAC, an autonomous institute under the UGC and Ministry of Education, focuses on particle accelerator-based research and development. The collaboration aims to advance technology and innovation in India.

items.title: Rail Vikas Nigam among 5 F&O stocks with a sharp rise in futures open interest
items.description: As of November 24, there was a notable surge in futures open interest for five stocks in the NSE F&O pack, contributing to a total increase of more than 10% compared with the previous trade. A sharp rise in futures open interest indicates the addition of fresh positions or expansion of existing ones, reflecting growing trader participation in the derivatives market.

items.title: HUDCO shares in focus after signing MoU with NIUA for urban development collaboration
items.description: Housing and Urban Development Corporation has signed a five-year non-binding MoU with the National Institute of Urban Affairs to collaborate on urban infrastructure initiatives, capacity-building programmes, research activities and financing exploration. The partnership aims to support urban development through joint programmes, evaluation frameworks and coordination with multilateral funding agencies.

items.title: Eris Lifesciences shares in focus on move to acquire Swiss Parenterals in Rs 423 crore deal
items.description: Eris Lifesciences is set to fully acquire its injectable unit, Swiss Parenterals. The deal involves a share swap valued at Rs 423.3 crore. This move aims to enhance operational control and financial integration. Swiss Parenterals, a significant exporter, has shown consistent revenue growth. Eris also reported strong Q2 performance with increased revenue and profit.

items.title: ACC among 5 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
items.description: On November 24, in the Nifty 200 pack, five stocks appeared in the RSI Trending Up scan on StockEdge.com. An RSI crossing above 50 indicates improving strength. Rising RSI values indicate building momentum, suggesting a possible upward movement and providing traders with an early opportunity to identify potential buying opportunities.

items.title: AWL Agri Business shares fall over 4% following Adani Group’s complete exit
items.description: AWL Agri Business shares fell after the Adani Group fully exited the company through a bulk share sale and sought reclassification as a public shareholder. The firm now has no promoter ownership. Technical indicators reflect a broadly bearish trend, while FIIs have significantly increased their stake, signalling renewed foreign interest.

items.title: Bitcoin continues recovery after hitting 7-month low, trades at $88K levels; Ethereum jumps 4%
items.description: Bitcoin rebounded from a 7-month low to trade near $88,000, gaining 2% in 24 hours as major altcoins also rallied. Ethereum jumped over 4%, while XRP, BNB, and Cardano rose 9%, 3% and 4%. Solana, Dogecoin and Hyperliquid gained up to 5%. Overall, global crypto market cap inched up 1% to $3 trillion.

items.title: Antique initiates Adani Ports & SEZ with Buy rating; sees 19% upside to Rs 1,773
items.description: Antique Stock Broking has initiated coverage on Adani Ports & SEZ with a Buy rating and a Rs 1,773 target, citing its growing scale, integrated logistics model and strong financials. With rising cargo volumes, expanding infrastructure and improving leverage, the brokerage expects robust revenue, EBITDA and profit growth driven by long-term structural tailwinds.

items.title: Labour reforms 2.0: What the new code means for India Inc
items.description: India's new Labour Code is set to simplify regulations and formalize its vast workforce. This reform promises greater security and fairer pay for millions of workers, including informal and gig employees. Businesses, especially in organized sectors, will benefit from reduced red tape and increased flexibility. The code introduces new rules for platform businesses and enhances employee protections.

items.title: India’s EMS sector enters a strategic expansion phase; Kaynes & Dixon Technologies top buys
items.description: India's electronics manufacturing is shifting from assembly to technology and component leadership, driven by domestic demand, localization, and government support. With significant output and export growth, the sector is poised for value-added expansion, focusing on critical components and deep-tech domains for global competitiveness.

items.title: Blue Star shares can gain 10%, says Motilal Oswal after initiating coverage with Neutral rating
items.description: Motilal Oswal initiated coverage on Blue Star with a Neutral rating, expecting up to 10% upside with a ₹1,950 target price. The brokerage highlighted Blue Star’s steady market share gains in room air conditioners—from 7% in FY14 to 14% in FY25—and its aim for 15% by FY27.

items.title: Waller flags weak labor market as Fed weighs December rate cut
items.description: The Federal Reserve is signaling that another rate cut in December is likely, based on recent comments from Governor Christopher Waller and San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Deutsche Bank sees S&P 500 soaring to 8,000 by next year
items.description: Deutsche Bank expects the S&P 500 to reach 8,000 by end-2026, the most optimistic target among major brokerages. The call is driven by strong earnings momentum and continued AI-led market gains. Their target signals a 21% rally from the index’s recent close of 6,602.99. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Japan's Nikkei erases most gains as SoftBank Group tanks
items.description: Japan's Nikkei index closed nearly flat Tuesday, with SoftBank Group plunging nearly 10% due to concerns over competition between OpenAI's ChatGPT and Google's Gemini. While chip-related stocks like Advantest and Tokyo Electron saw gains, mirroring Wall Street's tech rally, SoftBank's significant drop weighed heavily on the market.

items.title: India Inc. seen clocking 8-10% revenue growth in Q3 FY26, says ICRA. Here’s why
items.description: As a result, India Inc.’s credit metrics are poised for a marginal improvement, with the interest coverage ratio estimated at 5.3-5.5 times in Q3, up from 5 times in the previous quarter.Hospitals in some regions reported cancellations of planned surgeries, reflecting the broad impact of extended rains

items.title: What Jhunjhunwala, Kedia, Kacholia & other top investors bought and sold in Q2
items.description: Several well-known Dalal Street investors made notable portfolio adjustments during the September quarter, increasing stakes in select companies while reducing exposure in others based on their latest shareholding filings.This compilation, sourced by ET Bureau citing Primeinfobase.com, tracks stake changes made by prominent investors including Akash Bhanshali, Rakesh Jhunjhunwala (estate), Ashish Kacholia, Anil Goel, Mukul Agrawal, Nemish Shah, Vijay Kedia and Madhusudan Kela.

items.title: Is urge to trade getting the better of you? Zerodha's 'Kill Switch' is a remedy, says Nithin Kamath
items.description: Nithin Kamath urges traders to avoid over-trading, highlighting Zerodha’s Kill Switch feature that blocks further trades for the day. The tool lets users disable segments, prevent revenge trading, and re-enable access only after a cooldown period.

items.title: European shares muted as markets cautious ahead of US data
items.description: European markets showed a cautious mood Tuesday, with investors awaiting crucial U.S. economic data amid growing hopes for interest rate cuts.  Banks and commodity firms provided a lift, while Kingfisher surged on an improved profit forecast.  Progress on a Russia-Ukraine peace deal also offered a glimmer of optimism.

items.title: These 12 multibaggers of 2024 crashed up to 50% in 2025. Do you own any?
items.description: Indian equities continued their steady stride in 2025, with the benchmark index Sensex rising about 8%, mirroring the performance of the previous calendar year. But beneath the calm surface of the headline numbers, the broader market has delivered a far more dramatic story. Across the BSE universe, several stocks extended their strong multi-bagger rallies from 2024. Yet, just as many high-flyers from last year have come crashing down to earth in 2025. To track this reversal, we screened for companies with a market capitalisation above Rs 2,500 crore that doubled investors’ wealth in 2024 but have since corrected more than 30% this year.Roughly 25 stocks met the criteria. Among them, we spotlight 12 names that have taken the sharpest hit, falling over 35% in 2025 after delivering spectacular gains in the previous year. These former market darlings now serve as a reminder of how quickly sentiment can shift in India’s fast-moving equity landscape. (Data Source: ACE Equity)

items.title: The Wealth Company Mutual Fund receives Sebi nod to launch Specialized Investment Fund
items.description: The Wealth Company Mutual Fund, part of Pantomath Group, has received SEBI approval to launch its first-of-its-kind Specialized Investment Fund (SIF), branded 'WSIF'. This fund offers hedge-fund-like agility within a regulated mutual fund framework, aiming to provide differentiated performance through intelligent aggression and disciplined risk management for HNIs and sophisticated investors.

items.title: Time to review, relook & re-engage with mid-cap stocks? 7 mid-caps from different sectors with an upside potential of up to 38%
items.description: In the stock market, there are times when even the bulls don't know why they are so bullish. At other times, it appears bears are the only creatures on the street. There are, however, times when nobody is in control and the market is in a state of confusion. Like the one which we are currently in. Liquidity remains high, but valuations, though they have come down a notch or two, still cannot be called cheap. Then there are some events which the market is looking forward to but are getting postponed for one or the other reason. As investors, you need to deal with this situation, even though it will not last for long.

items.title: Market Wrap: Sensex slips 314 points, Nifty ends below 25,900 on monthly derivative expiry; PSU Bank stocks shine
items.description: Indian equities extended their decline for a third consecutive session on Tuesday, November 25, as a volatile derivatives expiry day impacted the market. The Sensex and Nifty closed lower, with major banking and IT stocks contributing to the downturn. While PSU banks saw gains, IT, Auto, FMCG, and Oil & Gas sectors faced significant pressure.

items.title: Swiggy shares down 25% in CY25: FIIs, MFs keep raising stakes, retail trims holdings
items.description: Swiggy’s share price has fallen sharply even as FIIs and mutual funds steadily raise stakes. Retail investors have trimmed holdings, while strong revenue growth is offset by widening losses. Analysts remain optimistic with a bullish long-term outlook.

items.title: Two Trades for Today: A financial services major for a 6.05% upmove, a mid-cap IT consulting stock for an almost 7% gain
items.description: Our technical analysts identify select stocks that may gain momentum even in volatile markets. Here are the technical calls for today.

items.title: Bharti Airtel promoter to sell Rs 7,200 crore stake via block deal
items.description: Bharti Airtel's promoter entity, Indian Continent Investment Ltd (ICIL), is set to offload approximately 3.43 crore shares, representing 0.56% of the company's equity. This block trade, valued at around $806 million, will reduce ICIL's stake to below 1%.

items.title: 10 midcap stocks see rising insurance shareholding in Q2FY26
items.description: An increase in insurance shareholding indicates that insurance companies have raised their stakes in a company during the current quarter compared to the previous one. In the NSE midcap segment, we highlighted the top 10 stocks that saw a rise in insurance shareholding from the June ’25 quarter to the September ’25 quarter, based on data from the StocksEdge shareholding scan.This growth in holdings often signals increasing confidence among insurers in these stocks, reflecting positive market sentiment. Since insurance firms typically invest after thorough analysis, the trend may also suggest a strategic shift toward enhancing returns through equity investments.

items.title: Adani Enterprises' Rs 24,930 cr rights issue opens today at 23% discount. Check issue price, entitlement ratio and more
items.description: Adani Enterprises has launched its ₹24,930-crore rights issue, offering shares at a 23% discount, with proceeds earmarked for major infrastructure expansion, new-age businesses and debt reduction, while promoters are expected to fully participate

items.title: Gainers & Losers: Groww, Brigade Enterprises among top 6 stocks
Reliance Industries, Hero MotoCorp among 9 stocks that hit 52-week highs; gains up to 21% in a month
items.description: On Tuesday, the benchmark Sensex fell by 313 points, closing at 84,587. Despite the overall market weakness, nine stocks in the BSE 200 index reached their 52-week highs, hitting their highest levels in a year. Such breakouts are generally seen by traders and investors as bullish signals, indicating strong upward momentum and the potential for additional short-term gains.

items.title: Market Trading Guide: Buy Rallis India, Lumax Industries and 4 more stocks on Wednesday for up to 9% gains
items.description: Nifty logged a third straight decline amid pressure in IT, auto and consumer stocks, with analysts flagging 26,000 as a crucial breakout level and identifying support near key moving averages while recommending select stocks for Wednesday’s trade setups

items.title: Sebi mulls simplifying paperwork, proposes higher threshold of Rs 10 lakh for duplicate share certificates
items.description: Sebi has proposed raising the limit for simplified duplicate securities documentation from ₹5 lakh to ₹10 lakh, introducing a common affidavit-cum-indemnity form, clarifying stamp duty norms, and standardising procedures across RTAs and listed firms to reduce investor hardship

items.title: US stocks open mixed as investors assess data, Alphabet shines
items.description: Wall Street's main indexes were mixed at the open on Tuesday as investors took stock of a series of delayed economic data to gauge the health of the U.S. economy, while Alphabet gained after a report said Meta was in talks to spend billions on the Google parent's chips.
